snippet: The Rev. Oliver White threw his clerical life into disarray in 2005 with a single act of principle at the General Synod of the United Church of Christ.
abstract: Samuel G Freedman On Religion column describes Rev Oliver White's return to preaching after his support of same-sex marriage drastically reduced his congregation and threw his clerical life into disarray; White now presides over diverse congregation comprised at Clark Memorial United Church of Christ in South St Paul, Minn.
lead_paragraph: The Rev. Oliver White threw his clerical life into disarray in 2005 with a single act of principle at the General Synod of the United Church of Christ.

headline.print_headline: Back in the Pulpit After Losing His Church, and Still Supporting Gay Marriage
headline.main: Back in the Pulpit After Losing His Church, and Still Supporting Gay Marriage

keywords.name: subject
keywords.value: Same-Sex Marriage, Civil Unions and Domestic Partnerships

keywords.name: organizations
keywords.value: Clark Memorial United Church of Christ (South St Paul, Minn)
